programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.sub-title: La haute couture face à la pandémie
programme.desc:
Season 6, Episode 35:

Haute couture in a pandemic How to face up to the Covid-19 pandemic in the world of haute couture? Alexis Mabille and the artists and craftsmen working in the world of fashion offer their answers. Focus on the photographers and runway show organisers who invented sustainable alternatives to bring back the lost magic.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Thai cuisine We explore Thai cuisine with Bruno Blanchet. From green papaya salad to coconut milk soup, the chefs Yao Truadmakkha and Ramida Inthanoochit help us discover the flavours of their cuisine. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
The alchemists
November. The winegrowers prepare the vineyards and warehouses for the winter. It's time to blend the year's wines and for the Mexican and Guatemalan seasonal workers to return home. The year ends with tastings, good 'piquettes' recipes, retirement for some and concerns about climate change.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Éric takes us to explore the marshes of the Charente-Maritime, an ideal ecosystem for horse breeding. Nathalie tries making Gigondas, in Orange. In Laval, Julie meets Mounir, a super presenter doing everything possible to connect people. In Paris, Yvan presents one of the most surprising "women from the 6th floor". Presented by: Éric Perrin, Nathalie Simon, Julie Hattu, Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Sancerrois The Sancerrois: an unspoilt micro-region on the banks of the Loire. Éric Louis welcomes us to his vineyards to share in his love of Sancerre wine, the Godon family let us in on the secrets of Crottin de Chavignol cheese, and we explore the Gargaude islands with Florence Delaroche. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.sub-title: Le restaurant bio Claire et Hugo
programme.desc: Claire and Hugo's organic restaurant Sophie Menut drives towards Sainte-Savine, just outside Troyes, and Claire and Hugo's organic restaurant. Chef Claire Baubrit and baker Hugo Lallemand are both self-taught and passionate about their profession. They also had a food truck, before taking on the challenge of opening a real restaurant with its own bakery-grocery store. Presented by: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: The Tales of Hoffmann After "Carmen" it is one of the most frequently-performed French operas in the world. "The Tales of Hoffmann", Jacques Offenbach's ultimate work, to a libretto by Jules Barbier, was created posthumously in February 1881. Robert Carsen was responsible for staging it in 2000. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Of trees, pits and stones The famous doctor-explorer Jean-Louis Étienne explains his relationship with trees and his view of climate change. Fruit stones and pits become a raw material in their own right. Exploring the Aldudes Valley in the Basque Country. Stéphane gets to work to transform an old hedge in Anna and Alain's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Girl Power The team takes part in the Swiss ice climbing championship in Saas-Fee. It's decision time for the Exped Team: where will they be going for their expedition? Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc:
The legends of Mortain
We head off to explore Mortain and the Sée valley, from waterfalls, to forests, rocks and the famous Mortain mist. An officially listed "Station Verte" known for its mysterious landscapes, it's also a land of legends and folktales, of King Arthur, fairies, goblins and even the devil himself!
Presented by: Vincent Chatelain.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Pumpkin curry and pesto
To use up the remains of a Halloween pumpkin, Ricardo suggests two recipes to cook both flesh and seeds: a chicken and pumpkin curry and pumpkin seed pesto.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Gaîté-Lyrique. Encounter with Camille Moncomble, part-jeweller, part-poet, to discover a world recounted with fantasy and modernity. Exploring freemasonry. Focus on the textile artist Viviane Sagnier and her creations in sculpted wool, coloured in infinite shades of ivory. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Marinated chilli peppers and stuffed sweet peppers Mathieu Cloutier marinates biquinho chilli peppers and prepares stuffed and bread-crumbed fried sweet peppers. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Geneviève and Éric, Estrie (Lawrenceville) Determined to leave everything to run a farm, Éric had his work cut out to persuade Geneviève to follow him with their three children. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Gobelins manufactory - Encounter with Hélène Timsit at the head of the Mazarine fashion house - Exploring New York - Encounter with the glass designer Bernard Pictet Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Cracovie (Pologne) Découverte du marché Stary Kleparz à Cracovie. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Vivian, Ontario
Louis helps out a client whose problem takes the form of two orphaned foxes.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Delights from the Middle East We set off on a journey to the Middle East with Manal Drissi, Elkhana Talbi and Les Filles Fattoush, a Syrian food service, and take a detour via Lebanon with the family behind the Trip de Bouffe restaurant. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of an industrial building dedicated to artistic production: Les Frigos. Encounter with Coralie Marabelle, environmentally-friendly designer creating clothing that's 100% French. Out and about in search of places where the music is good for both eyes and ears. Focus on Anne de La Forge and her enamelwork. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc:
Seafood tortellini
Annick Jeanmairet welcomes Marilé Micheletti, founder of Pâtes Manie, a small company in Geneva producing fresh filled pasta. On the menu: two-coloured tortellini with seafood filling.
Presented by: Annick Jeanmairet.

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc:
Champsaur, the two faces of a valley
Home to the sources of the River Drac, in the Hautes-Alpes, the Champsaur Valley perfectly combines tourism and a thriving local community. Winter sports and agriculture help keep the valley in balance, whatever the season.
Presented by: Laurent Guillaume.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
Grand-Lieu Lake
We head to the Maison du Lac with Fabrice, for a trip out on the water fishing for eels. Jean-Gabriel opens the doors to the Domaine des Hautes Noëlles wine estate. Exploring the trails around the Grand-Lieu Lake, discovering bird-watching and keeping a close eye on water quality.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Tales and legends of Haut-Doubs Once upon a time there was the Haut-Doubs, a land known for many tales, some of which are legendary. And when night falls, mysterious creatures invade the imaginations of Franche-Comté's inhabitants! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: In the Gironde, we follow in the footsteps of Montesquieu at the Château de La Brède. Encounter with the architect and designer Aline Asmar d'Amman. Addresses for climbing enthusiasts. On the Bassin d'Arcachon, Marielle Philip, head of Peau Marine, makes leather by tanning fish skins. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
